revision.text:
[[Farm|Farms]] with at least one ripe [[Berries|Berry]] can attract '''Wandering Pokémon''' that are automatically caught without the use of a Pokéball. Some Berries can attract rare Pokémon and can thus be used strategically to complete the Pokédex. Wandering Pokémon can also be [[Shiny Chance|shiny]], attracting a shiny Wandering Pokémon when the Farm has at least one open plot is the condition for a [[Starf]] Berry to spawn on the Farm (in one of the open plots). ===Table of Wandering Pokémon=== {|class="wikitable sortable" |- ! Pokémon !! Prerequisite/Ripe Berry Needed |- | [[File:Tangela.png|30px]]Tangela, [[File:Scyther.png|30px]]Scyther || N/A |- | [[File:Pineco.png|30px]]Pineco, [[File:Heracross.png|30px]]Heracross || Reach Johto |- | [[File:Volbeat.png|30px]]Volbeat, [[File:Illumise.png|30px]]Illumise || Reach Hoenn |- | [[File:Burmy.png|30px]]Burmy (plant), [[File:Combee.png|30px]]Combee,
[[File:Cherubi.png|30px]]Cherubi, [[File:Munchlax.png|30px]]Munchlax || Reach Sinnoh |- | [[File:Sewaddle.png|30px]]Sewaddle, [[File:Karrablast.png|30px]]Karrablast || Reach Unova |- | [[File:Charmander.png|30px]]Charmander, [[File:Cyndaquil.png|30px]]Cyndaquil, [[File:Torchic.png|30px]]Torchic,
[[File:Chimchar.png|30px]]Chimchar, [[File:Tepig.png|30px]]Tepig, [[File:Fennekin.png|30px]]Fennekin || [[File:Occa.png|20px]] Occa |- | [[File:Squirtle.png|30px]]Squirtle, [[File:Totodile.png|30px]]Totodile, [[File:Mudkip.png|30px]]Mudkip,
[[File:Piplup.png|30px]]Piplup,[[File:Oshawott.png|30px]]Oshawott, [[File:Froakie.png|30px]]Froakie || [[File:Passho.png|20px]] Passho |- | [[File:Pikachu.png|30px]]Pikachu || [[File:Wacan.png|20px]] Wacan |- | [[File:Bulbasaur.png|30px]]Bulbasaur, [[File:Chikorita.png|30px]]Chikorita, [[File:Treecko.png|30px]]Treecko,
[[File:Turtwig.png|30px]]Turtwig, [[File:Snivy.png|30px]]Snivy, [[File:Chespin.png|30px]]Chespin || [[File:Rindo.png|20px]] Rindo |- | [[File:Snover.png|30px]]Snover || [[File:Yache.png|20px]] Yache |- | [[File:Riolu.png|30px]]Riolu || [[File:Chople.png|20px]] Chople |- | [[File:Gulpin.png|30px]]Gulpin || [[File:Kebia.png|20px]] Kebia |- | [[File:Larvitar.png|30px]]Larvitar || [[File:Shuca.png|20px]] Shuca |- | [[File:Tropius.png|30px]]Tropius || [[File:Coba.png|20px]] Coba |- | [[File:Natu.png|30px]]Natu || [[File:Payapa.png|20px]] Payapa |- | [[File:Nincada.png|30px]]Nincada || [[File:Tanga.png|20px]] Tanga |- | [[File:Sudowoodo.png|30px]]Sudowoodo || [[File:Charti.png|20px]] Charti |- | [[File:Shedinja.png|30px]]Shedinja || [[File:Kasib.png|20px]] Kasib |- | [[File:Bagon.png|30px]]Bagon || [[File:Haban.png|20px]] Haban |- | [[File:Absol.png|30px]]Absol || [[File:Colbur.png|20px]] Colbur |- | [[File:Skarmory.png|30px]]Skarmory || [[File:Babiri.png|20px]] Babiri |- | [[File:Togepi.png|30px]]Togepi || [[File:Roseli.png|20px]] Roseli |- | [[File:Manaphy.png|30px]]Manaphy || [[File:Liechi.png|20px]] Liechi |- | [[File:Mew.png|30px]]Mew || [[File:Petaya.png|20px]] Petaya |- | [[File:Jirachi.png|30px]]Jirachi || [[File:Starf.png|20px]] Starf |- | [[File:Flabébé_(Yellow).png|30px]]Flabébé (Yellow)* || Any of the following:
[[File:Aspear.png|20px]] Aspear, [[File:Sitrus.png|20px]] Sitrus, [[File:Pinap.png|20px]] Pinap,
[[File:Iapapa.png|20px]] Iapapa, [[File:Qualot.png|20px]] Qualot, [[File:Grepa.png|20px]] Grepa,
[[File:Nomel.png|20px]] Nomel, [[File:Wacan.png|20px]] Wacan, [[File:Shuca.png|20px]] Shuca,
[[File:Charti.png|20px]] Charti, [[File:Chilan.png|20px]] Chilan, [[File:Jaboca.png|20px]] Jaboca,
[[File:Kee.png|20px]] Kee |- | [[File:Flabébé_(Blue).png|30px]]Flabébé (Blue)* || Any of the following:
[[File:Oran.png|20px]] Oran, [[File:Kelpsy.png|20px]] Kelpsy, [[File:Passho.png|20px]] Passho,
[[File:Yache.png|20px]] Yache, [[File:Coba.png|20px]] Coba, [[File:Rowap.png|20px]] Rowap,
[[File:Maranga.png|20px]] Maranga, [[File:Apicot.png|20px]] Apicot |} Note: As of version 0.8.9, [[Pokémon with Alternate Forms|Flabébé (Yellow) and Flabébé (Blue)]] can only be obtained as Wandering Pokémon. ===Strategy and Wandering Pokémon Rates=== The Base Wandering Pokémon Rate is 0.0005 or 1/2000. As the game checks for a Wandering Pokémon every 1.5s, the Rate of finding a Wandering Pokémon on a single plot is approximately 1/3000s. This rate can be heavily modified in the following ways. First, each plot that meets the requirement for a particular Wandering Pokémon is counted individually. Second, [[Roseli]] Berries have an Attract Aura that can further modify the Wandering Pokémon Rate multiplicatively. Below are some examples illustrating how incorporating these two techniques can improve one's odds of encountering Wandering Pokémon. * Example 1: 1 [[Cheri]] Berry on Farm, highest region is Johto. :- Rate = 1/3000s Chance of encountering Tangela, Scyther, Pineco, or Heracross * Example 2: 25 Cheri Berries on Farm, highest region is Johto. :- Rate = 1/120s Chance of encountering Tangela, Scyther, Pineco, or Heracross * Example 3: 25 [[Liechi]] Berries on Farm, highest region is Sinnoh. :- Rate = 1/120s Chance of encountering Tangela, Scyther, Pineco, Heracross, Volbeat, Illumise, Burmy (plant), Combee, Cherubi, Munchlax, or Manaphy * Example 4: [[Starf#Roseli + Lum Setup|Roseli + Lum Setup for Starf Berry]], highest region is Hoenn, Rates with fully ripe field. :- Rate = 1/43s Chance of encountering Tangela, Scyther, Pineco, Heracross, Volbeat, Illumise, or Togepi (The [[Roseli]] Plots) :- Rate = 1/217s - Chance of encountering Tangela, Scyther, Pineco, Heracross, Volbeat, or Illumise (The [[Lum]] Plots) [[Category:Farm]][[Category:Berries]]
revision.comment: /* Strategy and Wandering Pokémon Rates */ Starf Setup

[[File:Maranga.png|20px]] Maranga, [[File:Apicot.png|20px]] Apicot |} Note: As of version 0.8.9, [[Pokémon with Alternate Forms|Flabébé (Yellow) and Flabébé (Blue)]] can only be obtained as Wandering Pokémon. ===Strategy and Wandering Pokémon Rates=== The Base Wandering Pokémon Rate is 0.0005 or 1/2000. As the game checks for a Wandering Pokémon every 1.5s, the Rate of finding a Wandering Pokémon on a single plot is approximately 1/3000s. This rate can be heavily modified in the following ways. First, each plot that meets the requirement for a particular Wandering Pokémon is counted individually. Second, [[Roseli]] Berries have an Attract Aura that can further modify the Wandering Pokémon Rate multiplicatively. Below are some examples illustrating how incorporating these two techniques can improve one's odds of encountering Wandering Pokémon. *Example 1: 1 [[Cheri]] Berry on Farm, highest region is Johto - Rate = 1/3000s Chance of encountering Tangela, Scyther, Pineco, or Heracross *Example 2: 25 Cheri Berries on Farm, highest region is Johto - Rate = 1/120s Chance of encountering Tangela, Scyther, Pineco, or Heracross *Example 3: 25 [[Liechi]] Berries on Farm, highest region is Sinnoh - Rate = 1/120s Chance of encountering Tangela, Scyther, Pineco, Heracross, Volbeat, Illumise, Burmy (plant), Combee, Cherubi, Munchlax, or Manaphy [[Category:Farm]][[Category:Berries]]

First, each plot that meets the requirement for a particular Wandering Pokémon is counted individually. Second, [[Roseli]] Berries have an Attract Aura that can further modify the Wandering Pokémon Rate multiplicatively. Below are some examples illustrating how incorporating these two techniques can improve one's odds of encountering Wandering Pokémon. *Example 1: 1 [[Cheri]] Berry on Farm, highest region is Johto - Rate = 1/3000 Chance of encountering Tangela, Scyther, Pineco, or Heracross *Example 2: 25 Cheri Berries on Farm, highest region is Johto - Rate = 1/120 Chance of encountering Tangela, Scyther, Pineco, or Heracross *Example 3: 25 [[Liechi]] Berries on Farm, highest region is Sinnoh - Rate = 1/120 Chance of encountering Tangela, Scyther, Pineco, Heracross, Volbeat, Illumise, Burmy (plant), Combee, Cherubi, Munchlax, or Manaphy [[Category:Farm]][[Category:Berries]]

[[Farm|Farms]] with at least one ripe [[Berries|Berry]] can attract '''Wandering Pokémon''' that are automatically caught without the use of a Pokéball. Some Berries can attract rare Pokémon and can thus be used strategically to complete the Pokédex. Wandering Pokémon can also be [[Shiny Chance|shiny]], attracting a shiny Wandering Pokémon when the Farm has at least one open plot is the condition for a [[Starf]] Berry to spawn on the Farm (in one of the open plots). ===Table of Wandering Pokémon=== {|class="wikitable sortable" |- ! [[File:Maranga.png|20px]] Maranga, [[File:Apicot.png|20px]] Apicot |} Note: As of version 0.8.9, [[Pokémon with Alternate Forms|Flabébé (Yellow) and Flabébé (Blue)]] can only be obtained as Wandering Pokémon. ===Strategy and Wandering Pokémon Rates=== The Base Wandering Pokémon Rate is 0.0005 or 1/2000. As the game checks for a Wandering Pokémon every 1.5s, the Rate of finding a Wandering Pokémon on a single plot is approximately 1/3000s. This rate can be heavily modified in the following ways. First, each plot that meets the requirement for a particular Wandering Pokémon is counted individually. Second, [[Roseli]] Berries have an Attract Aura that can further modify the Wandering Pokémon Rate multiplicatively. Below are some examples illustrating how incorporating these two techniques can improve one's odds of encountering Wandering Pokémon. Example 1: 1 [[Cheri]] Berry on Farm, highest region is Johto - Rate = 1/3000 Chance of encountering Tangela, Scyther, Pineco, or Heracross Example 2: 25 Cheri Berries on Farm, highest region is Johto - Rate = 1/120 Chance of encountering Tangela, Scyther, Pineco, or Heracross Example 3: 25 [[Liechi]] Berries on Farm, highest region is Sinnoh - Rate = 1/120 Chance of encountering Tangela, Scyther, Pineco, Heracross, Volbeat, Illumise, Burmy (plant), Combee, Cherubi, Munchlax, or Manaphy [[Category:Farm]][[Category:Berries]]

[[Farm|Farms]] with at least one ripe [[Berries|Berry]] can attract '''Wandering Pokémon''' that are automatically caught without the use of a Pokéball. Some Berries can attract rare Pokémon and can thus be used strategically to complete the Pokédex. Wandering Pokémon can also be [[Shiny Chance|shiny]], attracting a shiny Wandering Pokémon when the Farm has at least one open plot is the condition for a [[Starf]] Berry to spawn on the Farm (in one of the open plots). ===Table of Wandering Pokémon=== {|class="wikitable sortable" |- !
